com.epoch.db
Class TranslationRW

java.lang.Object
  com.epoch.db.DBTables
      com.epoch.db.TranslationRW
All Implemented Interfaces:
StaticLimits, QuestionConstants, XMLConstants
public final class TranslationRW
extends DBTables
implements QuestionConstants, StaticLimits

Contains all database read and write operations pertaining to translations. Translations of ACE phrases have negative ID numbers derived from the hashcode; translations of question content have positive ID numbers derived from a sequencer.

setTranslations

private static void setTranslations(Connection con,
                                    String language,
                                    Map<Integer,String> insertPhrases,
                                    Map<Integer,String> existingPhrases)
                             throws DBException
Stores translations associated with phraseIds that have already been assigned to phrases that are being translated, and commits all previous transactions. The kind of phrase is not needed, so this method can be used for question statements, evaluator feedbacks, and question data.

Parameters:
con - database connection
language - the language of translation
insertPhrases - translations of phrases that don't already have translations in the current language (because IDs were just now assigned), mapped by IDs
existingPhrases - translations of phrases that already had IDs associated with them but may or may not already have translations in the current language, mapped by IDs
Throws:
DBException

getTranslatedParts

static void getTranslatedParts(Statement stmt,
                               List<Integer> phraseIds,
                               Map<Integer,int[]> itemIdsByPhraseIds,
                               Map<Integer,Question> questions,
                               Map<Integer,String> headers,
                               String[] userLangs,
                               int itemType)
Gets translations of headers, question statements, evaluator feedbacks, or question data from the database and replaces the English versions.

Parameters:
stmt - database statement
phraseIds - ID numbers of the phrases to be translated
itemIdsByPhraseIds - array of identifying information of the items whose phrases are being translated, keyed by the phrase ID. The size of the identifying information depends on itemType:
when itemType == HEADERS, its one member is the question set's ID;
when itemType == QSTMTS, its one member is the question's unique ID;
when itemType == EVALS, its two members are the question's unique ID and the evaluator's major ID (serial number);
when itemType == QDATA, its three members are the question's unique ID, the question datum's serial number, and the type of data (Marvin or other).
questions - questions being retrieved whose components are being translated
headers - common question statements associated with the questions whose components are being translated
userLangs - languages preferred by the user in order of preference
itemType - whether headers, question statements, evaluator feedbacks, or question data are being translated

modifyItem

private static void modifyItem(List<String[]> translations,
                               String[] userLangs,
                               int[] itemIds,
                               Map<Integer,Question> questions,
                               Map<Integer,String> headers,
                               int itemType)
From all translations of a particular phrase in all languages, gets the translation in a preferred language (if any) and replaces the English version.

Parameters:
translations - list of two-member arrays, each containing a language and the translation of the phrase into that language
userLangs - languages preferred by the user in order of preference
itemIds - array of identifying information about the item being translated:
when itemType == HEADERS, its one member is the question set's ID;
when itemType == QSTMTS, its one member is the question's unique ID;
when itemType == EVALS, its two members are the question's unique ID and the evaluator's major ID (serial number);
when itemType == QDATA, its three members are the question's unique ID, the question datum's serial number, and the type of data (Marvin or other).
questions - questions being retrieved whose components are being translated
headers - common question statements associated with the questions whose components are being translated
itemType - whether headers, question statements, evaluator feedbacks, or question data are being translated

getBestTranslation

private static String getBestTranslation(List<String[]> translations,
                                         String[] userLangs)
Gets the optimum translation from a list.

Parameters:
translations - list of two-member arrays, each containing a language and the translation of the phrase into that language
userLangs - userLangs preferred by this user in order of preference
Returns:
a translated phrase, or null if none was found

assignQTranslations

public static void assignQTranslations(Question newQ,
                                       QTranslations translns)
                                throws DBException
Assigns translations of a duplicated question or one acquired from an XML file. All translations need phraseIds assigned.

Parameters:
newQ - question whose translations to assign
translns - translations of question statement, evaluator feedbacks, question data in various languages
Throws:
DBException

assignHeaderTranslations

public static void assignHeaderTranslations(int qSetId,
                                            List<String[]> phraseTranslns)
                                     throws DBException
Assigns translations of a common question statement of a question set acquired from an XML file.

Parameters:
qSetId - unique ID of the question set whose headers are being translated
phraseTranslns - list of translations; within each list item, first member of array is language, second member is translation
Throws:
DBException

storeTranslations

private static void storeTranslations(Connection con,
                                      int phraseId,
                                      String[][] phraseTranslns)
                               throws DBException
Stores one phrase's translations into several languages.

Parameters:
con - database connection
phraseId - unique ID of the item being translated
phraseTranslns - array of arrays; first element is translation number, second element is language or translation
Throws:
DBException

setBestTranslation

private static void setBestTranslation(List<String[]> translations,
                                       String[] userLangs,
                                       int phraseId,
                                       Map<Integer,String> englPhrasesByIds,
                                       String[] phrases)
Replaces an English phrase in a map keyed by phrase ID with the translated phrase from the most preferred language (if a translation is found). Modifies phrases!

Parameters:
translations - list of two-member arrays, each containing a language and the translation of the phrase into that language
userLangs - languages preferred by the user in order of preference
phraseId - ID of the phrase whose translations are wanted
englPhrasesByIds - map of English phrases by IDs
phrases - array of phrases (mix of already translated and not yet translated); modified by method

addEnglish

public static void addEnglish(String[] phrases)
                       throws DBException
Adds English phrases to the database if they are not already in it.

Parameters:
phrases - array of English phrases
Throws:

the ISO 639-2 code, or null if not found
